page.title: 10HOUSING ESTATES IN OXSHOTT
page.content: Most of the houses in the area were built after 1945 in the gardens or grounds of larger houses built in the 1880's/1890's. Most of those houses have been pulled down or are now schools or institutions (e.g. the Schiff Home, formerly Knowle Park). The post war houses are typical middle-class suburban homes, semi-detached with large well kept, well stocked gardens. The charm of many roads and cul-de-sacs is increased by the the well grown trees that were planted in the grounds of former estates (e.g. two magnificent Wellingtonias in Lodge Close (square 9) are still preserved. In 1945, 6 council houses were built on cheaper land in square 6. They are well kept 3 bedroomed house with metal window frames. After 1951, about 12 more council houses were built.
